snippet: Not long after the 10 p.m. curfew began, the police used pepper spray and made several arrests after a small group of protesters confronted officers, throwing rocks and bottles.
abstract: Thousands of people gather in front of Baltimore's City hall to peacefully protest for end to police abuse of black men and end to curfew imposed by Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake; by end of day, however, violent confrontation erupts when small group of protesters confronts police officers after start of 10 pm curfew.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Blinder, Richard Fausset, Nikita Stewart and Rebecca White.

lead_paragraph: Not long after the 10 p.m. curfew began, the police used pepper spray and made several arrests after a small group of protesters confronted officers, throwing rocks and bottles.

headline.main: After Thousands Rally in Baltimore, Police Make Some Arrests as Curfew Takes Hold
headline.print_headline: Peaceful Rally of Thousands in Baltimore Is Followed by Unrest After Curfew
